block.p: Colleen Tracey Butler and Michael Joseph Sheridan Jr. were married yesterday at the Greek Orthodox Archdiocesan Cathedral of the Holy Trinity in Manhattan. The Rev. Dr. Robert G. Stephanopoulos performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Terence Wall, a Roman Catholic priest and the bridegroom's uncle, taking part.

Mrs. Sheridan, 30, is an intelligence research specialist for the F.B.I. in Manhattan. She graduated from the College of Mount St. Vincent. She is a daughter of Emily Notaras of South Huntington, N.Y., and Donald J. Butler of Airmont, N.Y. Her father retired as a lieutenant in the New York City Fire Department.

Colleen Tracey Butler and Michael Joseph Sheridan Jr. were married yesterday at the Greek Orthodox Archdiocesan Cathedral of the Holy Trinity in Manhattan. The Rev. Dr. Robert G. Stephanopoulos performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Terence Wall, a Roman Catholic priest and the bridegroom's uncle, taking part.

Mrs. Sheridan, 30, is an intelligence research specialist for the F.B.I. in Manhattan. She graduated from the College of Mount St. Vincent. She is a daughter of Emily Notaras of South Huntington, N.Y., and Donald J. Butler of Airmont, N.Y. Her father retired as a lieutenant in the New York City Fire Department.

Mr. Sheridan, 29, is a freelance producer of television documentaries, working currently on programs about the Children's National Medical Center in Washington for ''Lifeline'' on the Discovery Channel. He graduated from Dickinson College. He is the son of Kathleen Wall Sheridan of Yonkers and Michael J. Sheridan of the Bronx. His mother is the assistant to the dean of the school of architecture, urban design and landscape architecture at City College in Manhattan. His father is a manager at a United Parcel Service operations center in Manhattan.
